title: Drew Gilpin Faust
summary: Catharine Drew Gilpin Faust (born September 18, 1947)[1] is an American historian and was the 28th President of Harvard University, the first woman to serve in that role.[2]  Faust is the former dean of the Radcliffe Institute for Advanced Study; she was Harvard's first president since 1672 without an undergraduate or graduate degree from Harvard and the first to have been raised in the South.[3][4]
